Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: consa
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location at the Rambla, its settled futher down so the noice is less, but there is little noice if you get a room directed to the street. The rooms are ok, triple room is very priceworthy. The staff is friendly and helpful, and speaks ok english. The breakfast is not the one you remember, but is there any hotel in Barcelona that serves good breakfast (scandinavian style!!!)? The metro is just outside and the buses towards Barceloneta and the harbour is on the opposite side.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KittyHo Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very small room. there is TV, but you have to crane your neck to watch TV. it's clean and the service people are very friendly. location is great! the famous Tablao Flemango is right in front of the hotel. recommend to experience the traditional Spanish show. the hotel sells the ticket, so you don't have to wait in line. very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoGev
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona with two of my friends during summer last year, we booked a room here, a triple. pretty decent size room, bathroom was clean, the beds were okay, a little small, the balcony was the best part overlooking Las ramblas, which is one of the coolest parts about barcelona. The location was great, it was close to the bus which takes you the beach and Barceloneta area, and pretty easy to get a cab. They also have complimentary breakfast and a room with a computer, wi-fi, and a few books and travel coupons. The only bad part was coming to the hotel at nights, las ramblas can be a pretty scary place around 2-3 AM, but if youre careful and youre in a group of a few people you should not have any problems. Overall, a pretty nice place, location is great, the price was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly Noisy with Indifferent Staff”
Reviews.Author: DonTomasCanada
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights near the end of March and were given a room on the first floor. All through the night, we were awakened by the sound of running water, trays(?) being stacked- it sounded like we were beside a kitchen. The staff explained that several rooms extend into the building beside it. Why would you rent out a room when you know this is an issue? (I know...silly question) Secondly, we were there when the Spanish General Strike was scheduled (Mar 29). At first the front desk denied any knowledge that this existed. Despite their obvious devious behavior, we contacted our airline and were advised to leave a day early. There response was one of complete indiffernce and we were told to contact Agoda for a refund....Good Luck. Agoda claimed we would hear from the hotel and later told us no refund would be forthcoming. Customer service is lost on these avaricious clowns- if you've got a problem, avoid this place and Agoda like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: P Y Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this is a clean budget hotel in a central location. No frills rooms. I personally would not stay on Ramblas again. Too touristy for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RodNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Great location on Las Ramblas and Barri Gotic. Our room was very quiet though which was a pleasant surprise considering the partying going on close by. Very clean and well set up. Furnishings good for two star hotel. Staff were pleasant and very helpful. Despite being non smoking our first room had clearly had smokers busy before us but we were moved to another room quite easily. Breakfasts were good in pleasant room over looking Ramblas. Nice lounge and Internet access on that floor.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: Ian B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Superb location on the Rambla. Take care with pickpockets as witnessed 2 instances. Friendly staff and ok breakfast. View from castle fantastic. If you can get to a game at the Nou Camp highly recommended. Get tickets via club website before you leave home. Metro to the ground only 15 mins. T10 metro/bus tickets good value at 9-10 Euros and can be used for > 1 person per trip (check back of card for usage). Taxi from airport double the reverse trip, check with driver. Quoted 48 Euros in and 28 back. Zoo was better than expected. Nearby famous market very impressive, watch out for the nut lady who fills a bag and wants to charge 20 Euros before you can so no!

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: L. T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located. Breakfast was good enough for us. Nice rooms with a great view and a balcony. The beds slept well. But the frontsite (Ramblas) of the hotel is very very! noisy all night long till the morning. After a night without sleep we bought earplugs. We could only sleep with the earplugs in against the noise. Our daughters had a room at the othersite of the street. That room was very quiet but had no view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, anything else was average”
Reviews.Author: Meir S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: if you care only for location it is nice place. the bad was tiny. serviece was good. I believe there is better valvue for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice time in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location, excellent staff and service. Breakfast could be less bread and more fruit...But all in all perfect value for money

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Rachel U
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several years ago and just stayed again recently. The staff is super friendly. I love the location on Las Ramblas, too. I was there on a Sunday/Monday and there were tons of people on Las Ramblas, but felt very safe at this part of the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but NOT for light sleepers!!”
Reviews.Author: bengeorge
Reviews.Content: Great value place to stay, great location for a city-break. The breakfast is basic (croissant, tea, coffee) but good enough for the money. Staff are great, the 24 hour reception is handy too. Decor might be out-dated but it is very clean. WiFi was easy to connect to and worked. Ok so the bad: its on Las Ramblas so its very noisy outside!!. And since the windows are only single glazed you will not get much sleep on a weekend if you are a light sleeper. Otherwise its perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Who wants to stay locked up in a hotel room in Barcelona, anyway!”
Reviews.Author: la_1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is value for money, safe and in the best location on la rambla. Highly recommended as I only used it for a base to sleep as there too much to do in Barcelona then to stay locked up in a hotel room. Breakfast was included and is like all European hotels so don't expect a full 'american' breakfast but was nice enough. Staff were very helpful with things to do in Barcelona and spoke good English, as a solo traveller I felt safe at this hotel and had a great time in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Natalie D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location with great views overlooking La Rambla from our room. The hotel price was reflected by the location and the staff were very nice and helpful. My only disappointment was that I felt the rooms could have done with a paint, the floor was very dated as was the furniture in the room but it seemed clean which is my biggest concern when booking a hotel. The building itself i liked though with a nice old staircase and large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, breakfast should be improved”
Reviews.Author: ivijuliane
Reviews.Content: a trip with mys sister in January. Perfect location, clean, helpful staff, spacious bedroom, Wi fi and computers available. The 2 down things: smell of the cigarretes on the corridors . he breakfats could be so m,uch better. JUst include some fresh bread/fruit and this hotel would be excellent TIP: Guet a taxi to and from airpot cost us less than 30 euros !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: mcouldrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in October to see Barcelona and attend a football match. The room was a little older but still clean and decent in size. Room had a balcony overlooking La Rambla and the location was excellent in the quieter end of La Rambla. It was a little noisy at night but that's a sacrifice to be able to walk out the front door and be on the main street of Barcelona. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - had a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: liambr
Reviews.Content: Had a good two night stay at this hotel last week. Location and value for money were our main reason for booking. Hotel is smack bang in the middle of Las Ramblas. This means excellent transport links and lots to do nearby, but it's also very noisy (on top of a metro also), and plenty of undesirable types lurk on the street at night. Service was good, food not bad. Room was decent. Good budget option.

Reviews.Title: “great deal, great location, nice hotel, weak service”
Reviews.Author: Alex W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights in Barcelona. Got a great 3 for 2 deal for starting my trip on Monday which was part of the plan anyway, so got great value for my stay. The room was beautiful and everything worked perfectly. Nice little breakfast every morning as well. Location is literally perfect for Barcelona, in the heart of the action but never heard any street noise at all. All things considered it was excellent, but dont expect the people at the front desk to be very helpful. They were willing to help when pushed but it felt like we were hassling them whenever we asked for directions or recommendations. But if you are resourceful this is a great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lindarann
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October 2011 - I suggest reviews more than, say, a year old be ignored. Everything in the room was obviously new (including bathroom ), must have had a major refurb. recently. Very clean & comfortable; friendly staff. Continental breakfast included cereals, cheese, yogurts, juice as well as croissants & pastries & a large variety of hot drinks. Great location, thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: kells123
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 23rd of September in a double room with a balcony overlooking the Ramblas, it was festival time and we had great views over the Ramblas for the parades, this is a lovely hotel with really helpful staff.It is clean and safe and has the bonus of a continental breakfast included in the price.There is free wi fi and use of computers in the lounge, there is even a microwave for guests use and drink machines, they also have ice available, it is a great location and a good budget hotel. this is our second stay and we will definitely stay again, thank you to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Patty_T_S
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night only. The hotel is located in La Rambla, near from Liceu metro station and in front of Palau real. My room was on the third floor, it was nice, basic and clean. I`m not a light sleeper so I slept well even if there was noisy. It has a free Wi-fi with a good connection . The bathroom was clean too, with hair dryer, clean towels. The breakfast was OK, it had croisant, pastries packed, bread and juice. The staff was very friendly and very helpful, also they kept my luggage after I checked out. The only bad thing is when I came to the room for the first time, it smelled.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBateman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a short break for two nights. Excellent location right on Ramblas, near metro & easy to reach from Aerobus stop. Easy to get to main attractions & harbour just a stroll away. We had a twin room with small balcony overlooking Ramblas. The room was basic but big & clean with free WiFi & aircon. Staff incredibly friendly & helpful. Steeped in history with lovely original features. They were even filming a TV documentary in the lounge when we were there. We'll definately be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “"Impressive Hotel, great stay in a wonderful city"”
Reviews.Author: kellogirl41
Reviews.Content: The hotel was smack in the middle of everything yet when my windows were closed, I head none of that. Beautiful hotel in a wonderful and very beautiful city. From the breakfast to the bed, I was impressed. Everything was within walking distance. The beautiful city harbor was just down the street. Great wireless service that worked well with my Ipod. I kept their business card because my next trip to Barcelona I would definitely stay there again because I was impressed with all of my stay there. You can walk for hours around the area, take the hop on/hop off bus tours or a taxi all from just minutes from the Hotel. Very convenient, great location right on the busy walk where you can see all of what is going on from your room, great helpful staff, clean rooms and cool in a very hot weathered place. Yep...I sure would return to this hotel and to that city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; will stay again”
Reviews.Author: kdplusfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel prior to boarding a cruise. Hotel is right on Las Ramblas and very convenient for local sightseeing and also access to the port - just walk to the other side of the Columbus monument at the bottom of Las Ramblas and catch the port bus. Hotel is very clean and the rooms we were allocated had small verandas attached. Adequate continental breakfast and also balconies overlooking Las Ramblas, and the facinating street performers, from the dining room and lounge. Two computers available for complimentary acccess to the internet. Even with proximity to Las Ramblas our sleep was not disturbed. We were also able to leave our luggage in the hotel following completion of our cruise and this allowed us to spend a few relaxing hours in Barcelona, without hauling luggage around, before we caught our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: KForbes33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel on La Rambla. It has a traditional feel with stained glass and tiled floors but was well kept clean and cool. It was great to get a triple room with 3 beds for 3 friends travelling together. It is so centrally located and we had a street balcony which was wonderful to watch the world go by. We had a great view of the Christopher Colombus status at the end of La Rambla. Barcelona is a late night city though so despite double glazing if you are a light sleeper the noise will keep you awake. Ask for a room at the back for a quieter night. August is hot in the city and we were grateful for quiet efficient air-conditioning in the room. The breakfast is continental but adequate for filling up before a long tourist day. We also went to La Boquaria Market for some wonderful sandwiches for an alternative breakfast. The market is across the road and 2 or 3 minutes walk away. Staff were curtious and happy to keep luggage after we checked out. Thank you for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth L
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family in a 4-bedroom for three nights. Hotel is perfect, staff, room as well as location. I will definitly stay here next time I visit Barcelona! E Lindgren, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “No Thrills, Excellent Location, 4th Stay”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireStone
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the H4N 4 times between 2001 and 2010, on each of my visits to Barcelona. I have stayed with mates, with my wife and with family on a group visit. Each time the staff have been really friendly and helpful. This is not a luxury hotel, but is always clean and tidy and is ideally, centrally located for exploring the sights of the centre of Barcelona. Couple this with the price and it offers excellent value for money. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted to stay in a basic hotel, right in the heart of the city at an affordable price. If that's what you want then you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room for 4 persons June 18/20th 2011. Friendly staff. Excellent location. Quiet room with large terrace. Nothing fancy but verfy clean and well worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, but no thrills.”
Reviews.Author: CALookingForParadise
Reviews.Content: Without the location this is a 3 star hotel at best. Think your typical Best Western decor. Clean? yes. Fancy? No! But the air conditioning was amazing, the front desk helpful, breakfast was free and passable, wifi free and decent. Ask for a room with a view of Las Ramblas. It is really one of the best spots on Las Ramblas. This is a value hotel only, but it is a good value. We paid 98 euro tax and breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with the best location!”
Reviews.Author: Chania_Endaxi
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for three nights and we couldn't have choosen a better hotel! The staff is very nice and helpful, the rooms are kept very clean and the location is really right on the spot. Even though we had a room facing La Rambla it wasn't noisy at all. I can only give this place my strongest recomendations!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Karakth
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this quaint Hotel on La Rambla which is steeped in history (founded in the 18th Century, it has seen the likes of Chopin and Buffalo Bill as guests). The staff were ever obliging and cheerful. The rooms were clean and spacious with a view overlooking La Rambla. The Hotel was not noisy at all (even though we had a group of students in the room next to us, we could only hear them in the corridor and not the room). The air conditioning of the room can get quite cold at night so you might have to get up and turn it off although we found it best to leave a blanket next to our bed and cover ourselves when it got too cold. There is a lounge area with vending machines and free Internet (even if you do not have a computer, the Hotel provides 2 clunky but servicable computers for use). The Hotel is situated ideally on La Rambla with plenty of restaurants all around and a taxi stand outside the door. Altogether we had a very pleasant stay and would definitely stay here again when next in Barcelona. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not great.”
Reviews.Author: MrsSteede
Reviews.Content: I was really disapointed in this hotel. Yes the location is great but that is not enough to make us return. The hotel room was old and tired and smelled a bit of feet. Our only window opened out onto a wall. The bed was small and so uncomfortable my husband couldnt sleep at all. The room did have aircon which worked well. Breakfast was also poor, prepacked pastries and warm yogurt. The member of staff who checked us in was pleasant but another we encountered in the evening was rather rude. I have stayed in a large number of budget hotels which put this one to shame. If you must stay in this area pay more for a better hotel if you can, but if you need this location and cant spend more it would do. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair access and review”
Reviews.Author: mishahu
Reviews.Content: After being able to find wheelchair access only in expensive hotels on the rest of our holiday, we gladly booked this hotel. Our room did indeed have a roll-in shower and rails in the bathroom. See pics. Service was good but there are reasons this is a budget hotel. Water pressure was LOW LOW LOW. The room and furnishings are spartan and breakfast ... go to the market and cafes instead. Best thing about the hotel is it's location. Step out into the excitement of Las Ramblas and it's an easy roll into the gothic quarter, and a healthy level push to the port and beachfront. Also an easy roll up to Placa Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: risk_analyst
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the price for this location, I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Right on La Rambla and easy to find. Originally we were going to stay in the Gothic District but I am glad we didn't! The Gothic District is a twisting mass of tiny roads, it would have been miserable trying to find a hotel in the area while dragging around luggage. Instead we stayed at this great hotel right off the main strip- close to restaurants with the Gothic District a mere block away for exploring. Word of warning, the reviews discussing the noise and bed firmness are not exaggerating. There was a lot of noise from the strip until around 5am (this is during the week) even with the windows closed. The walls are also fairly thin so you can hear people talking in the rooms on either side of you. We were pretty tired each night so we fell asleep with no problems but bring ear plugs just in case. There is also a/c so leaving the window closed to cut down the noise was not a problem at all. The beds were very, very firm but we both slept soundly on them. The desk staff is extremely friendly and spoke English fluently. The rooms were cleaned well and I have no complaints about the water pressure or accomodations. The breakfast was okay (store bought pastries, coffee/juice from machines) but we ate there every day as it was convenient and available when we were awake (the rest of the city seemed to sleep in until 9am)! Internet was available free from the hotel, beware if you are using the common room computers as some people seemed to camp out on them for hours. I recommend buying water from the front desk to keep in your room during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, this clean, comfortable hotel ticked all "our boxes"”
Reviews.Author: MOMOMC60
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was basic so if you are looking for luxury then go somewhere else. For us it ticked all the boxes, fantastic value at under 200 euros for three nights B&B, it was in a fab location right on La Rambla, convenient for the tour bus stops, lovely restaurants,and great "holiday atmosphere" right on La Rambla. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful, and knowleagable so make sure you ask them for info if you are staying there. The free Wifi was great as it meant we could "keep in touch" although there is so much to do in Barcelona that very little time was spent on the internet! If I had to criticise the hotel at all, I would have to say that the breakfast was not to my taste. If you want a decent cup of tea or coffee take your own! The yoghurts being "long life" were not refrigerated and I am not keen on warm yoghurt. I dont eat "carbs" so croissants are not suitable. Perhaps a provision of fresh fruit at breakfast could have been provided? The rooms (we had a double) were adequate in size, very clean,with clean towels every day. We got a taxi from the airport straight to the Hotel which cost 25 euros, but the staff at the hotel told us about the airport bus (an air conditioned coach) which leaves from Placio de catalunya, situated at the top of La Rambla,every 5 mins and at just over 5 euros each was a much better option! All in all a very enjoyable stay! If we get back to Barcelona we would stay at the same place without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: polar2bear
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great for the money. Right on La Ramblas and close to everything. They had a great sale that we took advantage of and got one night for free. There was nothing fancy with the hotel, but then again we didn't want fancy. We wanted a safe, clean place to sleep and that is exactly what we got. The hotel staff was very nice and even let us borrow an umbrella. The breakfast stuck to local tradition, so not large but filling enough until lunch. Our room was in the back so very quiet, except at times we could hear our neighbors, but in any hotel this happens so no surprise. The staff gave us food recommendations as well. They spoke English which was a huge plus as it helped tremendously. They even had free wifi which was a huge huge help as our luggage was delayed for 4 days and we were in constant contact with airlines to track it down. If we didn't have the internet, we would have incurred phone and internet costs. This was a definite added bonus to the hotel. All in all, we would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone else who would go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: majesty318
Reviews.Content: I am very picky when it comes to hotels. Despite the good reviews, I didn't expect much from this hotel - it seemed much too "budget" for my tastes. As it turned out, I was very pleased. We had a triple room overlooking Las Ramblas, and once we closed the balcony door at night, the outside noise did not disturb us. During the day, for the few minutes that we actually spent in the room, I loved overlooking all the activity below. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful and nice, giving us advice on restaurants and trains, and allowing us to extend our stay one night when our further plans changed - even though we had previously heard the hotel was fully booked. The room was not luxurious, but it was much larger than I expected with plenty of room for the three of us to move around without being in each other's way. It was also immaculate. Location is unbeatable: we walked down to the ocean and to Placa Catalunya (for the tour bus and the airport bus), and there was also a Metro stop right outside. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AuntCarolyn
Reviews.Content: Not surprisingly, this hotel is in an old, old building. Buffalo Bill slept there, ... really. We had the 4-bed room for 4 adults. It worked, but it wasn't pretty. The beds were firm. It was clean. The bathroom had what a bathroom should. We asked for a wake-up call which came on time. We paid 156 Euros for one night (divided amongst 4 of course). If you're a Hilton-type, though, I think you'd hate it. If you're a light sleeper you'd need a back room. The 4-bed room (they have only one) is at the front. On the weekend, including Sunday the 'party' on La Rambla goes on forever. We heard every happy sound. As a matter of fact, we left the hotel at 5:30 a.m. Monday and lots of people were still outside. No shortage of taxis, either. This is a bargain hotel, best for young revellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accomodation right on Las Ramblas. No frills but free wifi.”
Reviews.Author: RonaldFonjo
Reviews.Content: 3 nights. 2 people. room with bath. Very central, lots of activity around hotel but not noisy in room, free wifi, secure entrance, friendly staff, great value.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: barbara_miglentsis2
Reviews.Content: it was quite easy to findonce off the aerobus walk straight down las ramblas.great location very central .the hotel is basic clean the rooms overlooking las ramblas has great view for those who like city life .great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Very decent place, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ShlomiA
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there for 6 nights, in 3 different rooms. They were almost fully-booked right in the middle of our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and made a sincere effort to help us with a room for the middle night. Advice: BOOK IN ADVANCE for weekends. Breakfast did not vary at all, repeating itself during our whole stay. Was just enough for a breakfast, but nothing more. Rooms were tidy, mostly clean. Although other reviews claimed that some rooms are noisy, we had no problem whatsoever with sleeping in either of the 3 rooms in which we stayed (and we're noise-sensitive). Superb location, right at the lower part of Las Ramblas, and a short walk from two metro stations. The nearby La Fonda restaurant was excellent. Ask the staff how to get there. We've been there repeatedly during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Laks21
Reviews.Content: The biggest plus is the location. So strategic for food, transport,entertainment, etc. Room is cleaned everyday and well maintained. Suitable for those with young child. Given a cot. Had a room with 1 single bed and 1 double bed and with balcony facing La Rambla. Breakfast was the same everyday but no complain as not much expected from two star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: baconchild
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a flight to Barcelona and then came the horrible task of trying to find a reasonably priced hotel that wasn't miles out of the city centre and find it we did (eventually!). Hotel Cuatro Naciones was 700 euros cheaper than any other hotel we could find and it is situated right on Ramblas. Now this is not my favourite part of town and I was concerned about the noise however I needn't have worried as the double glazing was excellent. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Yes, it is basic but if you are travellers like us then you don't spend any time in your room except to sleep and shower. The staff were very friendly, the room was spotlessly clean and larger than I expected with a very good sized bathroom with lots of hot water. There is also a TV in the room and a safety deposit box which is included in the price of the room. Breakfast is basic but plentiful and more than enough to give you a good start to the day. There is a lounge area with free internet and they will happily store your bags for you if you have a late flight like we did. This hotel is a little gem in the heart of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Wow....FAB....Cool....Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Alpal21
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last week of July and had a front room over looking La Rambla(s) and apart from the noise of the street late at nite, we had a perfect stay. Staff are exceptional and friendly and have a great knowledge of their town..Breaky was continental and the staff catered for our Aussie tastes and allowed us to bring our own cereal and porridge for breaky. Location couldn't be better with taxi outside buses as well and La Rambla for interest. I spent hours just watching the traffic from our balcony. This was the perfect way to finish a 7 week "grand Tour" and a place close to my heart. People are friendly and helpful and the place I always say is "like Melbourne but 6 stories high " I just feel at home in this town and the hotel felt like coming home. I'll Be Back .....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: anetterasmussen
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in Barcelona. Perfect at La Rambla. Near everything

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price for the location”
Reviews.Author: aztec273
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of the action on Las Ramblas, and closer to the beach end so getting there on bus 14 or 59 is a snap. Hotel is nothing fancy and our AC sounded like a jackhammer the first night, but once we mentioned it at the desk to the staff they had it fixed and the rest of the time it was fine. We had a quad room and it + the bathroom were the biggest we had on this trip out of five hotels. Breakfast (continental) was included and was good, especially the croissants. Staff was always helpful and pleasant. On the same floor as the breakfast room is the sitting room with two computers with free internet and pictures of the hotel through the years, apparently Buffalo Bill and Albert Einstein stayed at the hotel when it was the finest in town. Overall a good value, but Barcelona was the least favorite town on our visit, everything was double the cost of everywhere else we went in Spain, and unless you like to drink and party the Gothic Quarter is dirty and smells like urine, especially now that it's hot. If I went back I would stay in the Eixampla area and just go the Gothic Quarter for the sights.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: travelboy1985
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cuatro Naciones is a very simple (not stuffy) hotel located right on the RAMBLAS of Barcelona and only a couple of minutes walking from the beach. The rooms are very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Even though the hotel is located in the heart of Barcelona, nights were quiet and it was no problem to sleep peacefully. If you are in Barcelona for the culture or shopping or a weekend get away; then this hotel is ideal because of its price and location!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location--great value!!”
Reviews.Author: fleurdemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights following a cruise. It was a short taxi ride from the port and although we arrived early, the room was ready. The room was fairly spacious and very clean and comfortable. We overlooked La Rambla, but with the window closed there was little noise. The air conditioning was very welcome as was the free wifi! The breakfast was fine although not fantastic. The front desk was always very helpful and informative. All in all a very charming hotel full of charm and character and a great value for the perfect location. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Good for price paid!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahMcEld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night at the end of May before picking up a Cruise. Excellent location on Las Ramblas. We arrived on an early morning flight and had no problems checking in early. The rooms are very basic but clean. We had a lovely balcony view of Las Ramblas and were so tired we slept through any noise. Very reasonably priced family rooms that could cater for 2 children as I found when trying to book that Barcelona hotels generally are not very accomodating for more than one child and charge over the odds so, if you need somewhere to stay with kids for a short trip then this hotel is ideal. The hotel itself is a lovely old building and I could make no complaints. The only thing that would really need to be improved on is the breakfast. The rooms could of course benefit from some modernisation however I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Nice, Clean and very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Mahmoud_Shomali
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of La Rambla. We were a party of 2 families. We all found the hotel very clean, nice and firendly staff. The price was reasonable and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: shaarawim
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in March and was lucky to arrive on monday and make a use of pay 2 stay 3 offer. reception staff are very friendly and helpful. i even checked in at 7 AM with no hassle of early check in as i expected. room was basic but kept clean. housekeeper was excellent. breakfast is basic continental. the best thing is the location. a great location in the heart of the city and a walk distance from all the major streets. another plus was the free wireless internet in the rooms with stable connection. the worst thing was the taste of the coffee coming from the coffee machine. can;t compare it to anything i know. yet, having no other option, i had to use it on several occasions. in general, good place with good value. but if it wasn't for the offer, i would say expensive. if i'm there again. very possibly would stay there

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gaalnorb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel with a young baby. The hotel is located just at La Rambla closer to the harbour/beach part. It is real value for money for a 2 star hotel: very nice and friendly staff, calm nights, clean rooms. It's close to the beach, to downtown and the heart of the city la rambla: you can always go back to the hotel room if you (or the baby) need a bit of rest during the day. The rooms have the basic facilities: shower gel, hair dryer, cupboards, secure safe and we also got a baby cot. The things that could be improved are the breakfast (very basic, but on the other hand there are numerous tapas bars in the neighbourhood) and don't forget your slippers (the tiled floor is cold).

Reviews.Title: “loved it !”
Reviews.Author: marciobrazil121
Reviews.Content: great value hotel considering barcelona is not a cheap place !! , very helpful and nice people, family run which gives it a more personal touch. location perfect for seeing the sights! will return and loved the city ..

Reviews.Title: “budget but comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: valleycommando
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel looks a little tired, The staff were always polite and helpful The rooms and bathroom were fine, and were cleaned daily. The breakfast although nothing to write home about was OK . Winter had arrived in Barcelona during our visit but the hotel was warm and the water in the bathroom always piping hot. All in all we found the hotel to be a good value 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth stay as good as the first.”
Reviews.Author: BarcafanLeicester
Reviews.Content: My son and I visit Barcelona once a year to see a football match and relax. This hotel is absolutely perfect for us. The staff are pleasant and always helpful. Rooms basic but clean. Have a nice buffet style breakfast overlooking the Ramblas. Wonderful location, easy access to the harbour, the Gothic Quarter and the excellent Tour buses. We always use the bus service which runs from the airport to Placa de Catalunya (?) costs only a few Euros and it is a short walk down the Ramblas to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location - could not be better.”
Reviews.Author: TheWoot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 5 friends as part of a Hen Weekend. I was slightly worried that the hotel would be poor but to be honest it was everything we needed. The rooms were adequate, each had a small double and a single bed, air con, en suite, hairdryer. I found on review sites that some had no windows, we had a double set of doors that opened onto a courtyard that had a roof, not much fresh air but it let in light and we had the air con. Breakfast was included, but to be honest i only ate there the first morning. It consisted of a sugar coated croissant, crackers, butter and jam. here were other cakes and biscuits available and a tea/coffee machine. To be honest you are better off going to a bakery . As you step out of the front door you are on Las Ramblas which is a pedestrianised area with market stalls and cafes on either side of the road. Be careful though on my last vsit i got caught out and paid £8 for a coke!! The harbour is lovely, with a leisure area with resteraunts and a couple of clubs in the shopping mall. This is about a 10 minute walk along past the stalls. The beach is a 20 minute walk away and is very nice. My tip would be to venture into the side streets and find all the hidden shops and cafes. Stay here if you visit Barcelona, you wont be disappointed. Cheap and cheerful and right where you want to be!

Reviews.Title: “Just Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DiegoGudja
Reviews.Content: As per previous reviews we found this family run hotel as superb. First and foremost the location is excellent ... everything is within walking distance (or metro for those who prefer this method rather than walking). The breakfast is much more than acceptable for a two star hotel. In 2007 we've been in a 3 star hotel in Bressanone - Italy and the breakfast didn't match such breakfast. Staff is much more than helpful, mostly if you ask one of the 3 brothers that own and run the hotel. However, all other staff is very helpful. I would suggest that if one buys the tickets for the Bus Turistic he/she buys them from the hotel as they are cheaper and you are given a booklet which includes various other discounts. Since we were a family of 5 persons we were given a family room which was just superb. If I could complain on something I would complain on the floor tidiness of the room; however upon remarking we received a better service. Moreover towels were replaced daily. Internet service is provided free of charge at the salon (there are two PCs and two monitors - one of them would be better if it's replaced with a flat screen). If I would visit this beatiful city of Barcelona I would surely reside in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central and safe location, friendly staff, lots of history”
Reviews.Author: pentatonictherapy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly placed for sightseeing, placed on the backbone street of Barcelona's tourist area. The Gothic Quarter, harbour, designer shops and park are all within easy reach. The air conditioning in the rooms is good, very handy when we had a 36 degree heatwave, and the selection of television channels entertaining when we were back in the room for a siesta! The staff are all friendly and though we were determined to speak Spanish for the majority of the trip, at least one member of staff spoke perfect English, smoothing out the gaps in our understanding. The room also had its own safe, providing extra protection for valuables. If I had to find fault it would be that for me, the breakfast was nearly inedible, consisting of stale croissant, warm synthetic yogurt and 'fruit' juice and bitter coffee, (and I'm incredibly un-fussy) however the excellent location means that other breakfasts are close by. The central location means that you are at the heart of the city's activity, so expect the noise level to go up around dinner (9-12pm), stay at a moderate level until 6am then explode with the nightclubs emptying, becoming quiet between 7 and 10am. The thunderous street-sweeping machines at 5am on the Tuesday we were there were impossible to sleep through, but we had plenty of good sleep otherwise. Overall a very good stay, very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gaillimh_abu28
Reviews.Content: Great service with very friendly staff. . . Breakfast was good. . . Coffee, Criossants, Biscuits, Juice and cereal provided in a buffet style. . . Rooms basic but spotless, good shower clean towels provided every day. . . Great location located on Las Ramblas. . . Room with Balcony available on request. . . Computer room with high speed internet access. . . Also Coffee machine (€1), drinks dispenser (€1 for Soft drinks and €1.50 for beer) and a library with very comfortable seats and a balcony with a great view down Las Ramblas. . .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok rooms, perfect for a cheap weekend break”
Reviews.Author: annamacl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a Hen Weekend in May 2006 and thought it was great. I'd go back again even though the rooms really are nothing special. The location is fantastic. The sun terraces are brilliant if you fancy getting some sun without having to venture out onto Las Ramblas and the rooms were spotlessly clean (from what I remember!) My Aunt (who is in her 50s) then stayed here after I'd recommended it and said she enjoyed the stay too. Don't expect too much luxury and you'll be fine. Would recommend it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a nice price”
Reviews.Author: poezeloes
Reviews.Content: Select this hotel in case you want to stay at the Ramblas. You can choose between silent site (at the back of the hotel and the Ramblas site). Big rooms, fully equiped bathroom. Great breakfast. Really nice staff, helpful and friendly. Just 96,50 Euro 1 room 2 persons. Ramblas 40 [-]

Reviews.Title: “Still good, but rooms smaller!”
Reviews.Author: jrk36
Reviews.Content: We revisited this hotel for 4 nights, 3 years after our first visit in 2005. The hotel is still very good (more especially because of its price). However, the room we had, fronting La Rambla, had been cut in half since that last visit - what had been a huge room, was now a small (but adequate) room with a minute balcony. The location is fantastic, the price is good, the rooms are neat and clean. Yes, we would still go back to it, but 'tis a pity the rooms have got so much smaller.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KELPO
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location. Almost in the city but still near e.g. the Aquarium. The room price was reasonable and it was a really familyroom for 5. Good service. Breakfast was modest but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: Xristos
Reviews.Content: The internal room that we stayed was very bad. Bad smell, range but cold and ugly bathroom, with a lovely view of a dirty skylight between buildings. Very bad breakfast that we only tried once, before go for a normal breakfast outside. We also gave to the reception some card postals (as they proposed) that never went to their destinations. The only good of this hotel is that is located in the center of La Rambla. The Hotel is very cheap but if you have to go outside to have a normal payed breakfast, it makes it normal price.

Reviews.Title: “loved location”
Reviews.Author: TexasCorkie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the middle of Las Ramblas, metro stop Liceu. Very convenient for walking/metro all Barcelona sights. Older hotel but very nice. Service was great, they speak English. Rooms clean, comfortable, shower, good AC, hair dryer. $90euro/double in July. Breakfast included, pretty plain, but great food is everywhere, including Starbucks. www.h4n.com

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a long weekend !”
Reviews.Author: RachelLeeds
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it is so much cheaper than other 3 or 4 star hotels, and it had such good reviews on Tripadvisor. We stayed for 3 nights and it was a great find. We were delayed and arrived very late but had no problems checking in. Our room was basic but 100% clean, spacious and air conditioned. We had a view onto Las Ramblas but it wasn't too noisy with the window shut. The room was cleaned every day, hotel staff were friendly, and the location was fantastic. We would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Cuatro Naciones”
Reviews.Author: prettyladylala
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Cuatro Naciones when we first arrived in Barcelona. The hotel we booked was locked when we arrived, so we needed to find a hotel asap to stay. We found Hotel Cuatro Naciones on Las Ramblas. The hotel was nice and clean looking and not too expensive. I think we paid approximately 95 Euro a night. The staff was friendly, professional, and helpful. They also spoke English if required. The double room was basic, but clean. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom was spacious, and the bathtub was big. The water was warm as well as the room when the heater was on. Because the hotel was on Las Ramblas, you could hear the noise outside especially from la placa. By the way, there are several clubs in the placa for young travelers. As for the breakfast, it consisted of cereal, pastries, juice, coffee, and jam. The breakfast host was the most wonderful, friendly older Spaniard. He was wonderful and took pride in his job. Out of most of the people we met in Spain, he was one of the nicest. Above all, all the employees were wonderful. As for location, the hotel is between two Metro stops off Las Ramblas. It is a great location for staying and being able to enjoy the city and people. The streets, off of Las Ramblas, were a little scary at night, but safe during the day. We were two women traveling, so safety was an issue. The streets had transients and beggers, but still safe because the police were present. I would also be careful about theives. Many service employees informed us to watch our bags and we did. Overall, I would stay at the hotel again. If you are going to Barcelona for a while, I would suggest visiting Montserrat and Figures. Both towns are beautiful and quaint. I would also try to see a Flamenco show, which could be seen at Cordobas, which is across the street from the hotel. Also have some sangria and bomba picantes at El Choquito. Although old and graffiti covered, the city of Barcelona is a great place to visit. It is full of history and amazing art. The people were okay, even though sometimes rude. Overall, a great city to visit at least once.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: marianne77
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay for 5 nights during end of September 2006 in this nice 2* hotel. The hotel has great prices and is centrally located within walking distance of most attractions, mid-way between two underground stations, each between 2 to 5 mins walking distance. Also you can catch the touristic bus just 5 mins walk from the hotel. The staff was very polite, cheerful and helpful. The breakfast offered was continental : croissant, bread, jam, cereal, coffee …. We had a room with small balcony over la rambla. The view was great, and with the double glass window, noise was not disturbing us, after all you don’t spend much time in the room in Barcelona. The room was small, but clean with air condition, free safe deposit box in room, satellite TV with TV5 and CNN besides spanish channels, and a hairdryer in bathroom. The shower head was connected to the wall in our bathroom. The only thing missing was a small minibar. There is a salon where you can find a microwave & a computer with free internet access. They have a luggage room where they can keep your bags if you arrive early. I would defenitly return back to this hotel when I go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget choice in central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Aroundtheglobe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cuatro Naciones for 4 nights in September 2006 and we can really recommend it! The room was absolutely clean when we arrived, and it was cleaned every day in a very efficient manner. Our room was to the back side of the hotel, so it was quiet. The breakfest was ok for us, a typical Spanish one. It kept us going until lunch (which in Barcelona is about 2.30 pm). The hotel is really in the middle of everything - the location could not be better. The front door opens to the Rambla, the harbour is 5 min away. The old town starts around the corner - everything we valued was just around us. Of course you can easily pay 800 € for 4 nights in Barcelona - or you can stay at Cuatro Naciones and pay 360 € for 4 nights as we did. Just think what you can do with the difference...

Reviews.Title: “It was just like the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: trotteuse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in late September 2006 during a business trip to Barcelona. From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I felt welcomed and very satisfied with my decision to choose this hotel. Other reviews on this site had mentioned what great atmosphere and service was to be had for such a great deal - and they were 100% true, right down to the best part of the establishment - those two lovely, charming gentlemen who insist on carrying your heavy bags to your room, showing you how everything works and helping you with the complimentary continental breakfast every morning. It was clean, spacious, very handy (right in the heart of everything on La Rambla) and the free WiFi service was an added bonus. The only improvement I might suggest is a wider range for the WiFi service all the way up to the 3rd floor as the signal faded on the 1st floor. Still, I had a lovely room with a terrace and a great stay. I would definitely go back and recommend to my friends and family. This place is definitely worth more that its two stars!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Des&Rick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel recently, few days before and after our Mediterranean cruise. For us it was an excellent location, on La Rambla, 20 minutes from the airport, near to the cruise port and to other touristic sites that you can visit just by walking few blocks or by taking public transportation. The place is very very clean, nothing fancy but it has everything you need if you are just looking for a save and clean place to sleep. It has a PC in the lounge with free internet access and breakfast is included, which is not the great thing but good enough to be included in the price. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, they even kept our luggage in a locked room before and after we checked in/out as we arrived early and left late. I read other reviews of people complaining about little details like decoration, breakfast, noisy rooms, etc...after all if you are on one the busiest streets of Barcelona where people never sleep what can you expect if you get a room with a balcony?, Also, If you know it is a 2 stars hotel don't expect chandeliers and Michelangelo’s pieces in the rooms...to conclude, this hotel has everything you need at an affordable price (compared to other similar hotels in the area) and we definitely would go back again. Desi and Ricardo, From Canada

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic location and is very cheap. However the decor is a bit old (even for a 2 star) The shower head was not connected to the wall, and the bath tub wasn't particularly clean. The room does have a safe, and hair dryer. As others have said the breakfast is poor. A crossiant is fine, but it needs to be fresh. However for the price it's a wonder breakfast is included. We found other guests to be quite noisy, but that is luck of the draw. It would be okay for a 1-2 night if you weren't too fussy. Personally, I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's the staff...”
Reviews.Author: jayandirene
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have already said it, but I'd like to repeat it: It's the friendly staff at Hotel Cuatro Naciones. My wife and I spent six nights there in the past three weeks: four before a cruise and two after it. My wife lost her plug adaptor, and the staff came up with a box behind the desk and loaned us one. The airline lost our luggage for a day, and the staff brought it up the moment it arrived. We arrived before rooms were ready when our cruise ended, and the staff placed our bags in a locked room until the room was ready, then moved everything themselves. They explained how to get to a theater that has movies in English. It's clean, it's in a great location; it's quiet. The only thing it isn't is expensive. At 85 euros per night (about $115), it's half what most hotels in Barcelona seem to go for.

Reviews.Title: “Historically important, family-run hotel on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: PorscheMainz_Germany
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Cuatro Naciones from February 9 - 14, 2006. This older hotel has been home away from home for Buffalo Bill, Ulysses Grant, Albert Einstein and, as I said, my wife and I. We selected it because of its location directly on Las Ramblas. While we found it to be an acceptable choice (approx. 80 Euros + tax for a double room), it is an older hotel and couldn't quite match the comfort of Hotel Principal, the other hotel we stayed at. Hotel Cuatro Naciones is located about 5 minutes walking distance from the harbor. We advise taking the public bus from the airport to Plaza Spanya (probably spelled wrong). From there, you walk down Las Ramblas for about 10 minutes, before finding the hotel on the right. We also did some wonderful dining in Barcelona during our 8-day stay and highly recommend the following two restaurants. Both are located within walking distance from the hotel and very good dinners cost "only" about 12 - 15 Euros: La Dolca Herminia (Magdalenes 27 / 08002 Barcelona (10 minute walk)) and La Fonda (carrer dels Escudellers 10 = right around the corner from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: olibhear
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel from 5-9th september this year. Excellent value for money 80 euro for double room ensuite with sky tv hairdyrer and balcony onto los ramblas....spotlessly clean, very friendly staff, breakfast wee bit crap...only a croissant and coffee but still ok and served until 11 am for long liers like me. great location near bottom of street bit noisy at night but maybe due to balcony over looking street... got recommended great restaurant 2 minutes around corner by hotel staff...la fondu...spanish food,white table clothes, nice lighting. we had two courses, two main courses, a litre of house wine....30 euro between us you may have to queue so get there early (opens at 8.30pm) or wait until 9.30 when people start coming out..great food and service.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: spacemonkey
Reviews.Content: The best location for the price. Nice rooms with friendly staff. you can't go wrong. Would stay there again and again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cuatro Naciones
HotelInfo.Address: La Rambla 40, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
